docs.text: when i first saw the preview for cruel intentions , i turned to my friend and said , " dangerous liaisons for kids ! "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it was clear to me that the film would be an obvious chunk of plagiarized nonsense , owing everything it is to stephen frears' 1988 masterpiece .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: imagine my surprise to see that writer/director roger kumble has given credit to his source material : choderlos de laclos is recognized for his novel les liaisons dangereuses in the opening credits .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and i was impressed .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in fact , i was much more impressed with this recognition than with the actual film , which is an appalling excuse for a movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's kiddie-porn hackwork , complete with earthy sex-talk and fully-clothed hand-jobs .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i suppose this kind of movie was inevitable ; with all the teen high-school angst movies coming out , there was certainly room for a pretentious and laughable movie about a bunch of teenagers who think they're smarter and more beautiful than all the other people on earth combined .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: cruel intentions is a mess in every possible way , and it fails primarily in the way i expected it to : i hated all the characters , and i hate everything they do .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i also hate ryan phillippe , so perhaps my opinion is not as objective as it could be .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: phillippe plays ( check out this name ) sebastian valmont .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: wow .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: isn't that a memorable name ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i could just say it over and over again .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sebastian valmont .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it kind of rolls off the tongue , in the spirit of phrases like sanguine vapors and velvet sandwich .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sebastian valmont is the coolest guy who ever walked the earth ; there is no woman he can't have , no material object out of his reach .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he has all the money , all the sex -- all at his fingertips .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and , luckily , his parents never enter into his life -- no , in the world of cruel intentions , adults don't really exist .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the ones who do are irritating .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sebastian valmont lives with his stepsister , kathryn merteuil ( sarah michelle gellar ) , the bitch-queen of the universe , and also the woman every man wants .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: since these two rich kids are so bored , they only thing they can do is challenge each other with meaningless sexual liaisons .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: kathryn wants sebastian valmont to de-virginize cecile caldwell ( selma blair ) , a naive dork-chick who has somehow wronged kathryn .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but it's too easy for sebastian valmont -- he wants to nail annette hargrove ( reese witherspoon ) , the " paradigm of chastity and beauty . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so , sebastian valmont and kathryn make a deal ( which is too explicit to state here ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but -- dear god !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: -- sebastian valmont actually begins to fall for poor annette hargrove .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: dangerous liaisons is a great movie because the characters are all believable , and because of its masterful acting .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: cruel intentions is bad for many reasons , but it lacks both believable characters and masterful acting .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: kathryn merteuil is simply a hateful witch , a girl so loathsome that i would probably enjoy pouring hot lead on her .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: she is supposed to be mean , but glenn close gave the character some depth in dangerous liaisons .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: gellar , while aesthetically pleasing , is one-dimensional and utterly repulsive .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: witherspoon has a truly beautiful face , but her character isn't the moral staple she's supposed to be : sure , she won't have sex until she's in love ( is this really a * moral * issue ? ) , but she does some things in the last few scenes that are more than a little reprehensible .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but i can't forget mr . phillippe , who continues to exceed my expectations with his impenetrable , invulnerable blandness .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i have to give him credit and say that he did , in fact , manage to change his facial expression about three times during the course of cruel intentions .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and there's one point in the film in which he shouts , thereby defeating my hypothesis that he is vocally monotone .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: true , he is bad , but it doesn't help that he has no character to work with .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: kumble has drained all the interesting aspects from this character , leaving us with a sex-crazed lunatic who is supposed to be sympathetic because he falls in love with a moral flower and shuns the wicked bitch .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film fails in every other way , too .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: first of all , nobody talks like this .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: even the " intellectuals " i know don't bother with this kind of pointless and pretentious yammering .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for a while , the movie looks like it might play itself for laughs , but it ends up taking itself so seriously that there's no way we can join it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: cruel intentions also manages to come off as soft-porn in more than one scene .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: earlier i mentioned a fully-clothed hand-job ; this occurs between kathryn and sebastian valmont , both of whom are intended to be hateful at this point in the movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so , if we hate them , then what's the point of an extended sex scene ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: titillation , of course .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it can't even work under the pretense of " meaningful love scene , " because we hate the characters .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's interesting to note some of the parallels between cruel intentions and dangerous liaisons .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: kumble is clearly familiar with the earlier film ; many of the scenes have a similar tone , and there are moments in frears' film that kumble imitates almost completely ( such as the last scene , in which [spoiler warning ! ] the antagonist is humiliated in front of her peers ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but kids don't act like this .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: nobody acts like this .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in his translation , roger kumble forgot character development and sympathy -- some pretty crucial elements .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the result is a picture of confounding badness , a kiddie-porn mess that thinks it's really deep and profound .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i'll give cruel intentions credit for realizing its influences , but that doesn't change the fact that it's awful .
docs.label: negative
